perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate shall be responsible for collecting all amounts due directly from the Consumer and shall bear sole responsibility for non-payment of any fees charged to the Consumer. Marketing Affiliate shall pay to Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in Exhibit A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall be responsible for collecting all amounts due directly from the Consumer and shall bear sole responsibility for non-payment of any fees charged to the Consumer. Marketing Affiliate shall pay to Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in Exhibit A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in full by Marketing Affiliate 60 days from the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the payment terms from 30 days to 60 days, creating a contradiction if Exhibit A specifies a different payment timeline or if another clause in the agreement relies on the original 30-day term. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 30 days of the due date of the invoice. The demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall jointly select an arbitrator.
perturbation.explanation: Section 2 initially states disputes must be demanded within 10 days of the invoice due date. This change extends that period to 30 days. Because Section 1 (above) also changed the due date, there is now two conflicts regarding 'due date' and 'dispute demand'
